title: 86/603/EEC: Council Decision of 8 December 1986 on the granting of national aid in the wine sector in Italy following the serious crisis affecting that sector as a result of the 'methanol-adulterated wine' affair
header:
COUNCIL  DECISION
of 8 December 1986
on the granting of national aid in the wine sector in Italy following the serious crisis affecting that sector as a result of the 'methanol-adulterated wine' affair
(86/603/EEC)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. The followoing national aid for distillation, granted by the Italian Government in the wine sector, shall be considered to be compatible with the common market until 31 December 1986:
- aid for the distillation of a maximum quantity of 2,5 million hectolitres of table wine at a price of Lit 3 750 per degree and per hectolitre,
- aid for the distillation of a maximum quantity of 170 000 hectolitres of white table wine obtained by the downgrading of Mosccato d'Asti DOC wines at a price of Lit 13 260 per degree and per hectolitre.
2. The following national aid for private storage, granted by the Italian Government in the wine sector, shall be considered to be compatible with the common market until 10 April 1987: aid for the private storage of quality wines psr produced during the 1985/86 season amounting to Lit 30 per day and per hectolitre.
This Decision is addressed to the Italian Republic.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 8 December 1986.
For the Council
The President
M. JOPLING
